intro: Eriostemon nodiflorus var. subglabriflorus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests or understorey habitats. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators like bees and birds, contributing to its ecological significance. The varietal form subglabriflorus is distinguished by its reduced leaf pubescence and slightly smaller floral structures compared to the typical variety.
